revised_title: Screw Dislocation Core Structure in Body-Centered Cubic Lattices Under Shear Stress
tldr: The authors studied the effect of shear stress on the screw dislocation core structure in body-centered cubic lattices. They found three distinct types of movement and discussed their relation to plastic flow and twinning in real body-centered cubic metals. The movement of the dislocation core can be rationalized in terms of the relative stresses needed to create generalized stacking faults on {110} and {112} planes.
